com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface TimestampService

All Superinterfaces:
Service
public interface TimestampService
extends Service

Provides corrected timestamps based on the server's/upstream's time.

Since:
5.2.3
Author:
Robert Clark

Method Summary
 long getApproxDiffToServer()
          Returns the approximate time difference with the server in milliseconds.
 java.util.GregorianCalendar getCorrectedTimestamp()
          Returns a timestamp that corresponds to the server's time, rather than the time on this machine.
 java.util.GregorianCalendar getCorrectedTimestamp(long localtime)
          Returns a timestamp that corresponds to the server's time, rather than the time on this machine.
 

Method Detail

getApproxDiffToServer

long getApproxDiffToServer()
Returns the approximate time difference with the server in milliseconds.

+ve means that the client is ahead of the server, -ve means the client is behind the server.

Returns:
the difference between local time and the server's time.

getCorrectedTimestamp

java.util.GregorianCalendar getCorrectedTimestamp()
Returns a timestamp that corresponds to the server's time, rather than the time on this machine. All timezone calculations will be included in the corrected timestamp.

Returns:
A Calendar timestamp that matches the server's current time.

getCorrectedTimestamp

java.util.GregorianCalendar getCorrectedTimestamp(long localtime)
Returns a timestamp that corresponds to the server's time, rather than the time on this machine. All timezone calculations will be included in the corrected timestamp.

Parameters:
localtime - The client's local time in ms. This should match the format of System.currentTimeMillis()
Returns:
A Calendar for the server timestamp that matches the provided local time.
